Package tools.data.file

Class FileTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.data.file.FileTree
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JarFileTree, WritableFileTree
    public abstract class FileTree
extends java.lang.Object
    A file tree describes a part of a file system. Every file tree has a single root file/directory.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected static java.util.Map<FileTreeToken<? extends FileTree,​?>,​FileTree> FILE_TREE_MAP
      The map containing all file trees.
      protected static java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock TREE_LOCK
      The lock used for concurrent access for creating file trees.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocalFileTree

        public static FileTree getLocalFileTree()
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets or creates the local file tree of this class.
        If this class is executed from a jar file, then a JarFileTree instance is returned. If this file is executed from a local .class file, then a DirFileTree instance is returned.

        Only creates a new file tree if needed.

        The root directory will be the root class path of the class (e.g. the execution directory).
        Returns:
        The local file tree of this class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the execution folder does not exists.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getLocalFileTree

        public static FileTree getLocalFileTree​(java.lang.Class<?> c)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets or creates the local file tree of the given class.
        If the given class is executed from a jar file, then a JarFileTree instance is returned. If this file is executed from a local .class file, then a DirFileTree instance is returned.

        Only creates a new file tree if needed.

        The root directory will be the root class path of the class (e.g. the execution directory).
        Returns:
        The local file tree for the given class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the execution folder does not exists.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getFileTree

        public static <C extends FileTree> C getFileTree​(FileTreeToken<C,​?> token)
        Returns the file tree which has the provided token. If no such file tree exists, then null is returned.

        The token implementation is different and undefined for each file tree class. A token should be obtained via the getToken() function.
        Type Parameters:
        C - The type of the file tree to return.
        Parameters:
        token - The token of the file tree.
        Returns:
        The file tree with the given token, or null if no such file tree exists.

      • getProjectSourceFile

        public static java.lang.String getProjectSourceFile​(java.lang.Class<?> c)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Parameters:
        c - The class to get the project root from.
        Returns:
        The project root file of the given class (e.g. the execution directory).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the execution folder does not exists.

        Returns:

      • traverse

        public TreeFile traverse​(TreeFile file,
                         java.lang.String... children)
        Traverses from the given file using the given child directories.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to start traversing from.
        children - The directories to traverse through.
        Returns:
        A file in the format file/children[0]/children[1]/.../children[n].

                        TreeFile file)
        Locks the file relative to the given tree.
        Parameters:
        tree - The file tree used as basis path for local files.
        file - The file to lock.

      • isLocked

        public boolean isLocked​(TreeFile file)
        Checks whether the given file or any parent directory of it is locked.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to check.
        Returns:
        true if the file is locked. false otherwise.

      • isLocked

        public static boolean isLocked​(FileTree tree,
                               TreeFile file)
        Checks whether the given file or any parent directory of it is locked. This includes the case where the file was locked by the current thread.
        Parameters:
        tree - The file tree used as basis path for local files.
        file - The file to check.
        Returns:
        true if the file is locked. false otherwise.

      • unlock

        public void unlock​(TreeFile file)
        Unlocks the given file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to unlock.

      • unlock

        public static void unlock​(FileTree tree,
                          TreeFile file)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalMonitorStateException
        Unlocks the file relative to the given tree.
        Parameters:
        tree - The file tree used as basis path for local files.
        file - The file to unlock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalMonitorStateException - If the file was not locked.

      • tryLock

        public static boolean tryLock​(FileTree tree,
                              TreeFile file)
        Obtains the lock for the given file, but only if it is not locked.
        Parameters:
        tree - The file tree used as basis path for local files.
        file - The file to unlock.
        Returns:
        true if the lock was obtained. false otherwise.

      • size

        public long size​(java.lang.String path)
        Determines the size of the given file in this file tree. If the file doesn't exist or cannot be accessed, then -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the file to get the size of.
        Returns:
        The size of a file in bytes, or 0 if the file could not be accessed.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • readAllBytes

        public byte[] readAllBytes​(java.lang.String path)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.OutOfMemoryError,
                           java.lang.SecurityException
        Reads all bytes from the given file and puts them in an array.
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the file to read all bytes of.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing all bytes of the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the stream.
        java.lang.OutOfMemoryError - If the array of the required size cannot be allocated.
        java.lang.SecurityException - If the security manager denies reading access of the file.
